channel.title: World News Headlines, Latest International News, World Breaking News - Times of India
channel.description: World News: TOI brings the latest world news headlines, Current International breaking news world wide. In depth analysis and top news headlines world wide.

image.title: World News Headlines, Latest International News, World Breaking News - Times of India

item.title: 'She will pay the price ...': Trump attacks Taylor Swift after singer endorses Harris
item.description: Former President Donald Trump dismissed Taylor Swift's endorsement of Kamala Harris, expressing his preference for Brittany Mahomes. Trump praised Mahomes, wife of Kansas City Chiefs quarterback Patrick Mahomes, and noted her support for him. This comes amid controversy over Brittany's social media activity and Swift's formal endorsement of Harris after the debate.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Kamala Harris emerges unscathed from debate, dancing around her flip-flops
item.description: Kamala Harris and Donald Trump engaged in a heated presidential debate where Harris criticized Trump's previous administration while deflecting questions about her own record. Trump attacked her on issues like inflation and immigration but appeared frustrated by the end. Harris's confident performance led to calls for another debate.
item.dc:creator: Chidanand Rajghatta

item.title: Russia-Ukraine war to get nastier? West mulls more firepower for Zelenskyy
item.description: Tensions between Russia and Ukraine remain high as the Kremlin vows to respond if the US allows Kyiv to use American-supplied missiles against Russia. This comes after President Biden's comments on the matter. US and British diplomats are in Ukraine discussing easing restrictions on Western weapons, amid concerns over Iranian missile transfers.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: 9/11 remembrance day: Key moments from the deadliest attack on US
item.dc:creator: Bandana Kanak

item.title: Abortion, Israel, immigration: Kamala Harris and Donald Trump lock horns in US Presidential debate
item.description: Abortion, Israel, immigration: Kamala Harris and Donald Trump lock horns in US Presidential debate

item.title: Russia pushes back Ukrainian troops in some areas of Kursk, commander says
item.description: Russian forces have started a significant counter-offensive against Ukrainian troops in the Kursk region, reclaiming approximately 10 settlements. This action comes after Ukraine's substantial attack into western Russia last month. Conflicting reports on territorial control persist, with scant information from the Russian defense ministry and no immediate comment from Ukraine.

item.title: Elon Musk’s offer to ‘give child’ to Taylor Swift sparks outrage: ‘How low can one go?’
item.description: Elon Musk surprised many by offering Taylor Swift a child and to guard her cats following her endorsement of Kamala Harris for president. His tweet drew significant backlash and confusion on social media, diverting attention from Swift's political message that praised Harris as a capable leader supporting LGBTQ+ rights and women's autonomy.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Mega Millions jackpot: Single ticket from Texas gas station wins $800 million prize
item.description: A Mega Millions ticket purchased at a gas station near Houston has won an $800 million jackpot. The winning numbers were 1, 2, 16, 24, and 66 with the gold Mega Ball being number 6. The winner can choose between annual payouts or a one-time cash option of $404.2 million.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Close call on Australian beach as plane door lands just metres away from fisherman
item.description: A plane door plummeted from the sky, narrowly missing a fisherman at South Broulee Beach, New South Wales. The incident took place around 9.30am on Friday when the door detached from a small private aircraft. Despite the dramatic event, both the pilot and passenger landed safely, leading authorities to forgo an investigation due to no injuries.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Who is Donald Harris? Academic behind Trump's 'Marxist' claims against Kamala
item.description: During the presidential debate, Trump accused Kamala Harris of being a Marxist due to her father Donald Harris's academic background in economics at Stanford. This aligns with Trump's strategy to portray her as more left-leaning than Biden. Kamala counters by emphasizing her support for a free-market economy.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Harris campaign celebrates presidential debate win, while Trump calls it his 'best debate ever'
item.description: Kamala Harris' campaign quickly declared victory following the ABC presidential debate, citing her strong performance against Donald Trump. In contrast, Trump's unexpected appearance in the post-debate spin room hinted at a different narrative, with his team appearing unprepared. The debate's aftermath continues to unfold as both sides assess their performances.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Harris says 'will not ban fracking' in Pennsylvania. What is this?
item.description: The Democratic nominee has altered her stance on fracking, now stating she will not ban the practice and hasn't done so as Vice President. Fracking is contentious due to potential environmental and health issues, yet supporters highlight its role in boosting domestic oil production and employment opportunities.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Betting market sees Kamala Harris win over Donald Trump: Debate takeaways
item.description: Republican Donald Trump and Democrat Kamala Harris engaged in a heated debate, discussing issues like abortion and Afghanistan. The debate saw Harris gaining favor in prediction markets. Both candidates exchanged sharp criticisms, with Trump defending his performance post-debate. The possibility of another debate before the November 5 election remains open.

item.title: Trump responds to Taylor Swift’s endorsement of Kamala Harris
item.description: Donald Trump responded to Taylor Swift's endorsement of Kamala Harris for the 2024 election with 'I have no idea.' Swift shared her support on Instagram, urging followers to research candidates. This follows her previous endorsements of Joe Biden and Kamala Harris in 2020 and Democratic candidates in 2018.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Elon Musk concedes in viral banter: 'Fine Taylor, you win' after Swift endorses Kamala Harris
item.description: Elon Musk humorously responded to Taylor Swift's endorsement of Kamala Harris for the 2024 election with a viral comment on X. Following the US presidential debate, Swift announced her support and addressed misinformation concerns. She urged followers to research candidates' positions. Musk acknowledged Swift's powerful cultural influence in shaping public opinion.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Kamala Harris' facial expressions take center stage in debate drama with Trump, netizens react to 'eye rolls and exaggerated smiles'
item.description: Vice President Kamala Harris faced intense scrutiny for her animated facial expressions during the ABC News Presidential Debate against former President Trump. Social media reactions were mixed, with critics calling her gestures rehearsed and questioning their authenticity. Some compared her expressions to those from the 2020 vice presidential debate against Mike Pence.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Anti-war protests turn violent at Australia's largest defence industry event
item.description: Anti-war protests in Melbourne escalated into violent clashes with police outside the Land Forces International Land Defence Exposition. Demonstrators chanted pro-Palestine slogans and waved flags while riot police used tear gas and rubber bullets to disperse them. The unrest led to several arrests and major road closures in the city.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: South Carolina Congressman Joe Wilson collapses from stroke-like symptoms at DC event
item.description: South Carolina Congressman Joe Wilson collapsed at an event in Washington, D.C., showing stroke-like symptoms. He was taken to a local hospital and is now stable. His son, Attorney General Alan Wilson, confirmed his condition. Ukraine’s Ambassador to Washington commended the swift medical response and stressed the importance of CPR knowledge.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: US presidential debate: Putin would 'eat' Trump 'for lunch,' says Kamala Harris
item.description: Kamala Harris criticized Donald Trump during a presidential debate, arguing that if he were president, Putin would have taken Kyiv. Trump stated his desire to end the Russia-Ukraine war without choosing sides. Harris emphasized her strong ties with Zelensky and the necessity of supporting international rules and alliances.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: At least 16 people killed in landslide in northern Vietnam
item.description: In northern Vietnam's Lao Cai province, a landslide caused by flash floods has led to at least 16 deaths and numerous missing persons. The incident buried 128 people, with only 30 rescued so far. Typhoon Yagi's heavy rain over the weekend complicated rescue operations in this remote mountainous area.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk
